channel.title: What do you think will make your RSPS 'spark'?
channel.description:
What do you think will make your RSPS 'spark'? If have a project or don't have a project (and have a great idea), post it here! How do you think that the server you are working on/the idea you have made will bring interested players in? What is that idea? Basically, I am here to start a unique discussion. Discuss your ideas.
tl;dr How will your RSPS attract players? Why? How will your idea attract players? Why?

item.title: What do you think will make your RSPS 'spark'?
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

Lin:

Custom maps and training areas. I’ve been wanting to make a decent map editor for a long time now but haven’t found the motivation to (ironic). I figure if someone makes a full custom island where everything can be trained and bosses can be taught, it’ll be the most fun and community-based server.

Do you have any design ideas of said island?

Read full topic
item.source: What do you think will make your RSPS 'spark'?

item.title: What do you think will make your RSPS 'spark'?
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

In my opinion three things can make a RSPS ‘sparkle’:

  1. The dev(s)/owner(s) having a rigid mindset.
  2. The dev(s)/owner(s) having an abstract mindset.
  3. A mix although generally speaking that means a larger team which tend not to work out within RSPS unless it’s clear who is in charge of what.

Abstract mindset tends to be more innovative, rigid tends to be more logical and safe.

I’m not stating whether these ideas I’m going to use are good/bad, I’m just going to state what type they are just to help emphasise my point:

Lin:

Custom maps and training areas. I’ve been wanting to make a decent map editor for a long time now but haven’t found the motivation to (ironic). I figure if someone makes a full custom island where everything can be trained and bosses can be taught, it’ll be the most fun and community-based server.

Rigid - Safe, logical idea - not particularly bad nor good

[quote=“Cres, post:5, topic:524112”]Had the idea a while ago, and I think asshole_rule had a similar idea since he sent it to me once (or was it someone else… not sure).
Basically, the whole world is PK area. There’s a Saradomin team and a Zamorak team and there’s ‘nodes’ which you can conquer.
These ‘nodes’ can be anything such as a city, mines, forests, boss areas, etc…
The essence of these nodes is that you can only enter it if your religion has conquered it.
The only way to obtain a node is to buy it, and the only way to do that is to outbid the war chest the current holder of that node has.
For example; Saradominists have conquered the Barrows node and have a total of 5.000.000 gp war chest for that area.
Zamorakians may outbid or buy that node for a value over 5.000.000
Another thing is that you can never know exactly how much is in a war chest, so you never know how much you have to pay.
If you pay less than the war chest, the money goes straight to the owner of the node.
If you pay more, you gain the node but the excessive currency is not refunded.

Kind of a political system that would involve major clans and a major overhaul of the system… oh well :p[/quote]
Abstract - Cba reading it fully (hence why I’m not making a comment on the idea itself) but I know it is

You don’t need any form of skill to make a RSPS ‘sparkle’ you just need some wisdom (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wisdom @ some of the people who think wisdom is a bad choice of wording)…

Read full topic
item.source: What do you think will make your RSPS 'spark'?

item.title: What do you think will make your RSPS 'spark'?
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“asshole_rule, post:4, topic:524112”]I’m actually working on a minigame as I post this, I’m just randomly generating a map, and basically making a hunger games like minigame.

Everyone will spawn in the middle where there are a couple chests scratch that, i’ll spawn them on the ground to grab food, weapons, armor, and runes, and after 15 seconds it’s going to be a free for all.[/quote]
that’s a neat idea!

[quote=“Cres, post:5, topic:524112”]Had the idea a while ago, and I think asshole_rule had a similar idea since he sent it to me once (or was it someone else… not sure).
Basically, the whole world is PK area. There’s a Saradomin team and a Zamorak team and there’s ‘nodes’ which you can conquer.
These ‘nodes’ can be anything such as a city, mines, forests, boss areas, etc…
The essence of these nodes is that you can only enter it if your religion has conquered it.
The only way to obtain a node is to buy it, and the only way to do that is to outbid the war chest the current holder of that node has.
For example; Saradominists have conquered the Barrows node and have a total of 5.000.000 gp war chest for that area.
Zamorakians may outbid or buy that node for a value over 5.000.000
Another thing is that you can never know exactly how much is in a war chest, so you never know how much you have to pay.
If you pay less than the war chest, the money goes straight to the owner of the node.
If you pay more, you gain the node but the excessive currency is not refunded.

Kind of a political system that would involve major clans and a major overhaul of the system… oh well :p[/quote]
Hmm, sorta nice for a PKing based server imo

Lin:

Custom maps and training areas. I’ve been wanting to make a decent map editor for a long time now but haven’t found the motivation to (ironic). I figure if someone makes a full custom island where everything can be trained and bosses can be taught, it’ll be the most fun and community-based server.

Haha, maybe!

Read full topic

item.title: What do you think will make your RSPS 'spark'?
item.dc:creator: @Cres Cres
item.description:
@Cres wrote:

Indeed. Also, to prevent the nodes from being completely dominated by one religion you’d add a maintenance fee for that node.
Holy fuck, I’m going to re-scribble these ideas for when I finally make my own server framework :fp:

Read full topic

item.title: What do you think will make your RSPS 'spark'?
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

[quote=“Cres, post:5, topic:524112”]Had the idea a while ago, and I think asshole_rule had a similar idea since he sent it to me once (or was it someone else… not sure).
Basically, the whole world is PK area. There’s a Saradomin team and a Zamorak team and there’s ‘nodes’ which you can conquer.
These ‘nodes’ can be anything such as a city, mines, forests, boss areas, etc…
The essence of these nodes is that you can only enter it if your religion has conquered it.
The only way to obtain a node is to buy it, and the only way to do that is to outbid the war chest the current holder of that node has.
For example; Saradominists have conquered the Barrows node and have a total of 5.000.000 gp war chest for that area.
Zamorakians may outbid or buy that node for a value over 5.000.000
Another thing is that you can never know exactly how much is in a war chest, so you never know how much you have to pay.
If you pay less than the war chest, the money goes straight to the owner of the node.
If you pay more, you gain the node but the excessive currency is not refunded.

Kind of a political system that would involve major clans and a major overhaul of the system… oh well :p[/quote]

I think I did pm you something like that, my idea was a lot more combat based though. I’d love to make a server like that, but it’d take so long to make and would be really hard to get players for, because it takes a good amount of players for something like that.

Read full topic
item.source: What do you think will make your RSPS 'spark'?

item.title: What do you think will make your RSPS 'spark'?
item.dc:creator: @Cres Cres
item.description:
@Cres wrote:

Had the idea a while ago, and I think asshole_rule had a similar idea since he sent it to me once (or was it someone else… not sure).
Basically, the whole world is PK area. There’s a Saradomin team and a Zamorak team and there’s ‘nodes’ which you can conquer.
These ‘nodes’ can be anything such as a city, mines, forests, boss areas, etc…
The essence of these nodes is that you can only enter it if your religion has conquered it.
The only way to obtain a node is to buy it, and the only way to do that is to outbid the war chest the current holder of that node has.
For example; Saradominists have conquered the Barrows node and have a total of 5.000.000 gp war chest for that area.
Zamorakians may outbid or buy that node for a value over 5.000.000
Another thing is that you can never know exactly how much is in a war chest, so you never know how much you have to pay.
If you pay less than the war chest, the money goes straight to the owner of the node.
If you pay more, you gain the node but the excessive currency is not refunded.

Kind of a political system that would involve major clans and a major overhaul of the system… oh well

Read full topic
